action.action-desc: Mr. Soto introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture, and in addition to the Committee on Natural Resources, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To increase the access of small farmers in Puerto Rico to Federal agriculture programs, and for other purposes.

section.header: Increasing the access of small farmers in Puerto Rico who grow specialty crops to Federal agricultural loan programs
section.text: The Secretary of Agriculture, through the Office of Advocacy and Outreach, shall increase the access of small farmers who grow specialty crops (as defined in section 101 of the Specialty Crops Competitiveness Act of 2004) in Puerto Rico to loans under the following programs:

paragraph.text: All microloan programs under the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act.
All programs for socially disadvantaged farmers and ranchers under the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act.
All programs for beginning farmers under the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act.
The emergency loan program under subtitle C of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act.

section.text: The Secretary of the Interior shall develop a program to allow small farmers to farm on Federal land in Puerto Rico if the Secretary determines thatâ€”

paragraph.text: the Federal land is not environmentally sensitive;
farming on the Federal land will not harm endangered native species or natural habitats; and
the Federal land is suitable for such farming.

section.text: The Secretary of Agriculture, acting through the Director of the Office of Advocacy and Outreach, shall carry out a training program to teach best farming practices to small farmers in Puerto Rico.
